meanings.definition: To pack too much or too many items into a container or suitcase.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overpack my suitcase when going on vacation.
meanings.sent2: She always overpacks her bag for a weekend trip.
meanings.sent3: Don't overpack your lunchbox, or it won't close properly!
meanings.sent4: His mind tends to overpack with worries before an important event.
meanings.sent5: The students overpack their backpacks with books for the new school year.

meanings.definition: An excessive amount of items packed into a container or suitcase.
meanings.sent1: The overpack of clothes made the suitcase too heavy to lift.
meanings.sent2: The overpack in the moving box caused it to burst open.
meanings.sent3: The fridge was an overpack of food after the holiday feast.
meanings.sent4: The overpack of toys in the playroom created a colorful mess.
meanings.sent5: The overpack of gifts under the tree delighted the children on Christmas morning.
